bow: my wife wanted me to ask if any other working mothers with young kids have any tricks to deal with extreme fatigue mommy brain my wife is extremely hardworking and she is struggling with stress and anxiety we have year old son and month old son in the past months we have had 10 various dr visits regarding our month old hearing loss issues and now moving forward into more visits with hearing aid fittings that stress alone is hard but she transferred to new school at the end of her recent maternity leave for her teaching position and that has added longer commute and all the stress of trying to learn new school and meeting exceeding administration and parent expectations for her position her new position is more rewarding but she pays for it in added stress and she does have as much planning as she used to she ca pump as much as she did with our first son and it really makes her feel like she is dropping the ball she also has second job that is normally rewarding that keeps her out nights week and can add several weekend requirements and lot of extra work in december with all of her current stress she is thinking about quitting the second job but she is worried that this feeling is only temporary and she would really regret it long term we also have added stress with her mother keeping the boys for couple days week it does help us financially and she is great with the boys but we have to pat her ego and deal with her throwing major and unwarranted fits on weekly basis we have talked about moving them to full time day care but it would only make the relationship worse with her and her mother and the kids would really take hit all of that being said she is having hard time balancing it all am there to help with the kids and house stuff but she finds that she is just failing at lot of small tasks that she normally handles this time of year is extremely hard on her and am thinking that if we can get through the next couple of weeks she will have some time off and her next semester will be easier and her stress and anxiety will diminish she did have added anxiety and depression during her pregnancy that she did have during her first pregnancy she took some safe antidepressants and it helped bit with the anxiety but it made her feel foggy and tired the added tired feeling was that big of deal because she was already tired from being pregnant shortly after the baby was born her hormones started to adjust and she started feeling lot better and stopped taking it she feels little bit like she did during pregnancy but it not as debilitating she does want to take the medication now because she feels like it would be counter productive because the added fatigue of the meds would just limit her even more wish we had enough money so only one of us had to work but it just not an option love my wife and do everything can can feel all the stress as well and it hurts me knowing how defeated she feels she asks that if you have any ideas for dealing with fatigue and stress to please let us know does it get easier thanks for any advice thoughts can she try different medication temporarily holidays are rough for stress and anxiety and the new drive new routine she trying to adjust to is hard do you guys need her to have the second job would she be able to spend more time planning or spending time with the kids you personally would want to cut out the second job myself if could as for daycare love it if you have good one bc of the socialization it provides for the kids with peers honestly wish had started my daughter sooner if you do go that route would stress to mil that is why you are enrolling them baby brain did go away for me after about two years back in it now with second kid so sorry if this was incoherent some time to yourselves helps if you can make that happen once or twice month hang in there honestly exercise coffee and sleep if did have those things would be looney tunes it gets easier than harder than easier im in the mkddle of chaos kids amp 18 mo amp two pups amp were in the middle of moving my daughrer got croup and the boys ans the flu needless to say we havent slept in weeks the house is half packed although it looks like tornado went through it drink alot of coffee chase my toddler and spend most of my day running off my feet but the more excercise the better feel and the less tired am also make sure eat huge balanced breakfast it makes all the difference also find im most productive in the am so ill do most of my tasks then also accept wont get to it all and thats okay the house doesnt have to be sparkling clean im sure kf she asks your year old how happy they are youll realise your doing much better job than you ever thought give yourself some credit relax and let her have time to herself and you as well and always make time for date night as for pumping have absolutely brilliant amp healthy formula fed kids and as for mommy brain get big calendar and cork board and app on her phone as long as we bave kids to worry about that will never go away as for her mom watching the kids you know best not her three is hard age they will test you and manipulate but going on 18 hes too cooll for mom or anything they grow up way too fast just take it one day at time my kids are all older now but we have and somehow made it through sometimes look back and am amazed that we did it though the things that got us through was to really just drop lot of our expectations of ourselves nobody has clean house with little kids nobody has everything together with little kids nobody has perfect meals with little ones we expected so much more of ourselves than was necessary when talk to my kids now they are between 18 25yrs they remember really crazy stuff we did they remember dancing with me in the kitchen they remember the dumb books we read everybody poops what was thinking they remember breakfast for dinner and dragging mattress into the living room for pizza movie to me did those things because was too tired to actually cook or because they were under my feet when actually made it into the kitchen to them they were great adventures as for fatigue make sure she goes for checkup with her doctor get her b12 her vit iron and her thyroid levels checked what thought was fatigue and anxiety was actually thyroid disease and anemia as for the other stuff caffeine helped me get through caffeine and napping with the kids there is nothing wrong with napping from 5:00 to 5:30 then starting dinner at 6:00 if she needs to if it takes dollar starbucks on the way home from school then go for it remember my husband taking the kids to the movie and he would promptly fall asleep in the middle of it they all survived at this point with your children being so young it matter of just hanging on for dear life just hanging in there with whatever means necessary and doing whatever you can do to squeeze little bit of joy out and sleep in when you can if you have to sleep with the baby in the room do it do feel bad if you have to nap in front of disney movie do it if you need another cup of coffee or tea or god forbid diet coke at 4pm do it it will get easier physically in few short years you will be yelling at them to wake up promise do know of any other medications that she has discussed with her doctor the one she did take during pregnancy was considered low risk for pregnancy and breastfeeding it kind of catch 22 as far as the job if we knew for sure that her mom could handle the kids until they started school then we could afford for her to quit the second job currently our oldest does go to take care days week and he loves it but with the relationship with my mother in law she could decide at any moment that she does want to do it anymore and the second job is the type of job that she could get again if she decided she wanted to work it again we do really get any time to ourselves or date nights because our family helps with the kids during the week they re not really into watching the kids on the weekends we could put them in full time daycare but that would hurt relations with our family and then our financial situation would be really affected which would also keep us from having any sort of date opportunities not trying to seem negative or depressing or anything it just the way things have been going we could roll the dice and she could quit and just hope that everything works out in all honesty the second job would relieve stress for her on mondays and tuesdays for couple hours but in the whole scheme of things do know if it would really help she gets to work with some colleagues that also understand what she going through and think it rewarding if she did do it think she would go home and do house work ll talk to her about the formula idea we do supplement now little bit think she was really hoping to get through flu season just to help with our youngest this is great advice dude exhausted just reading about your wife schedule kids jobs high maintenance mother and all the little tasks around the house no wonder she stressed you say you re doing all you can is that really true can you take on some more of those little tasks around the house make sure she gets time off tell her she doing an amazing job all those things can take the anxiety down lot my gut instinct is to say to lose the second job at least for while is it something she can leave for while and pick back up when things settle down she needs some downtime yeah pretty good at helping out around the house could try and help little bit more when can she does have anxieties about the house needing to be certain way before she can relax everyone tells her that she needs to let little things go with the house that with kids things are just going to be messy for while she backed off bit but it still hard if she has energy she is not going to focus on herself until she feels like chores are done feel like help more than the average husband do tell her that not asking for reward or anything but based off your comment just want you to know that do lot when she is doing her second job do everything feed the kids bathe the kids read to the kids pick up after the kids get the kids up in the morning and take them to my mother in law before work on the days that my wife does have her second job we re team when do everything together and we do really rest until both of us are done unfortunately if she leaves it very unlikely that she would be able to go back in the future it one of those jobs that is sought after and people do usually leave for long time she been doing it for 10 years diet is critical in this situation most people will be inclined to start eating junk food but it even more important to eat healthy now lots of plant based meals healthy starches and minimize sugar intake based off your comment just want you to know that do lot sorry it was totally not my intention to suggest that you laze about while she toils can see how it could come across that way thank you for pointing out that you two try to equalize the chores and you obviously care enough about her well being to look for ways to make her life easier sometimes it just really hard especially when there is new baby think it look us good year to find our groove after our second was born but approaching your post as mom who dealt with post partum anxiety and could never do all the stuff your wife is doing just am not that energetic person also it the holidays even the ones among us who love this time of year feel the pressure but say as long as she not feeling depressed or constantly anxious it reasonable to kind of white knuckle it through to the new year ok why are you the one helping around the house that implies it belongs to her and you can do bits and pieces as required flip that shit you now own the housework schedule meal planning and shopping and the kids drs appointment schedule you also own keeping track of the kids clothes and whether or not they have enough in the right size packing away and storing or donating the stuff that too small you now also completely own the kids social calendar birthday parties and associated gift giving delegate specific tasks to your wife and don give her another task until she finished the the first one she now helping you around the house if you can do it then the expectation she can is unrealistic and you need cleaner and possible house keeper if you re not sure what talking about google the mental load dude that lot hugs to both of you these are how work through things survive on coffee do have much time for exercise but walk the dog to daycare sometimes to pick up my toddler after work eating healthy is actually really important too and it totally ok to use formula understand feeling like you have to pump and the want of being able to do that for your kid but you also have to consider your health having other moms to vent to having time for yourself and not feeling guilty about making time for yourselves or to rest is important being willing to call sitter over even if your not leaving the house so you can do things is ok can you hire cleaning lady to come once or twice week what about downsizing your house to get home with lower mortgage teacher too 7th grade and have toddler took year off after having her so we sold our house and bought smaller more affordable one now back to work but only part time mornings agree with the other commenters who suggest she cut back on work and fuel her body with nutritious foods gt helping out around the house you do help you live there too it may be contributing to her stress that although you do lot of chores she the one who is the manager so to speak of the household stuff perhaps with her working two jobs lot of her fatigue may be relieved if you told her okay you do have to make sure do my part just do what you can and ll pick up the rest glad to hear that you work as team with chores only suggesting this as it trend that has been identified in modern relationships and you know your family better than do you ll know better than me if it applies to you or not the first step is setting realistic expectations for yourself she got to drop her second job and you both owe it to yourselves to put the kids in full time daycare check out justnomil if you need to little push to grow spines having full time daycare situation with reliable schedules and professionally managed not your problem providers is an amazingly huge relief ca even emphasize that enough but self care is something that most moms take years to figure out myself took several years to realize that should say no way more often than do she might also need counseling if she is having hard time standing up to her mother but you should first and foremost be doing what is best for your family save the child watching from your mil for weekends when her time with her grandkids also allows you and your wife some time alone and yes you should spend some of it together but encourage your wife to do things solo too or just take nap or sleep in there difference between helping with the house and kid stuff and being equally responsible or more for that stuff start keeping track of what could should to be done do you schedule doctor appointments do you notice when the kids need new clothes shoes do you remember when people have special events like birthdays and get gift card when it date night would you find babysitter and make the plans do you make meal plan for the week that stuff all adds up and is mentally draining did the grandparent caregiver thing and it was hard enjoy getting to pick up my kid share few pleasantries and get on without worrying about appeasing my family member if you do know how to fire her mom say that you want your little ones to have more social development with other kids it valid thing to desire and our son has developed lot from that alone beyond that find way to reassure her that you ve got this and can take care of lot more of the household management for me it helps if my husband does something to show his progress on something it sounds like one more thing to add but therapy may help her sort through her emotions too you make good point read an article recently that talks about the manager role in the house and how the mental stress of that can be taxing even if you re physically sharing half the chores things like scheduling doctors appointments reminding caretaker that child needs her medicine asking spouse to clean xyz this is added pressure that usually falls on the mother ll see if can find the article so you know she wants the house certain way before she can relax so do everything you can to make that happen am the same way it that if let it go it just means more work down the road get into routine to do the 10 mins of cleaning before both of you relax that the article had in mind too but do remember enough about it to find and link it ok my wording is perfect please do dissect my words am great father and partner cook clean shop surprise her and the kids with flowers and treats she constantly calls me her rock and says she would be able to do any of this with out my support she asked me to write post asking for advice from other mothers and took lot of time to explain how she feels if she wanted advice on how to get her husband to help more then think she would have asked me to do it lol understand that assuming not doing enough seems like low hanging fruit but it not what we are struggling with if have to go into detail on my schedule and stresses in detail the way went into detail about hers then will but think some of you are transferring some of your own frustrations into me you can google it by searching for the mental load here the comic that made the rounds while ago https www theguardian com world 2017 may 26 gender wars household chores comic for me it was all about survival mode during that first year we ate more take out didn exercise as much our house wasn as clean drank lot of cofffee it was hard but we survived had to learn to let some things go which is super difficult to do it sounds like from what you re saying is that your wife current situation is not sustainable and something has to go maybe that second job is not good right now and or maybe there are some other things that could help her free up her time it great to want to do it all but sometimes it not realistic also encourage your wife to spend some time taking care of herself for me would take short walks at work to get out and take breather sometimes lay on the floor of my office and take short nap oh and if she isn already she may want to check in with her doctor regarding the stress and anxiety hope things get better for all we so think that full time day care would help with current stress but we feel like it will add new stress for decent day care for our kids in our area we would have to spend 1500 month and we could just barely manage it but we would live paycheck to paycheck and if car broke down or an ac went out we would be up creek we also would be able to do anything for ourselves and would be able to provide any fun adventures and surprises that we like to give our kids right now we are saving as much as we can trying to build savings so that maybe when our oldest turns and youngest turns we can put them in full time day care our oldest was born in november so he wo get to start kindergarten until he is about to turn so that adds several months of extra child care mom of an almost year old working at high school and going to grad school coffee helps and my husband does so much our son is in daycare deal with my own anxiety and depression all the time and it really difficult couple things that helped took the free edx online course on the science of happiness your wife might not have time for that right now but highly recommend one of the books called the how of happiness by sonia lyubomirsky people are notoriously bad at figuring out what makes themselves happy taking the person activity fit diagnostic test helped me narrow down the chapters to focus on to get the most benefit and start with only couple of activities so it wasn overwhelming have your wife fill it out figure out the scores and have her focus on her top two activities not affiliated with this guy but using the direct link to the pdf here http www edbatista com files 2014 lyubomirsky person activity fit diagnostic pdf also get her to read or listen to the audiobooks for any of dr brene brown books really love the gifts of imperfection and it has helped so much in the way deal with life check out any of the ted talks with brene and also the 10 guideposts for wholehearted living empowering but also sobering stuff we re all wired for struggle but we can learn how to manage it better and believe that we are worthy of love and belonging at the same time everyone has given great advice so only add meditation ten minutes day helps me cope have nearly three year old and four month old my suggestion quit breastfeeding making it to six months is amazing also let your wife quit her second job hire maid service and lawn service tell your wife to stop doing her hair every day if she does that and stick it in bun if you can get an au pair they are worth their weight in gold do it your wife sounds exactly like me for all of our kids mombrain is real but now it something we laugh about omg when is real brain coming back so we can find all the remotes again do stress my hardest part was not killing my husband every time he slept or ate full meal or got to leave for work remember how much you love each other and just make promises that it will get better and you both will still love each other as far as her stress shuck it out the window dishes or bath bath laundry or watch tv on sofa yep got it is do feel guilty about dirty house we all have dirty houses some just hide it better and work related stress my husband and talk about work to each other so we do let it stress us out we bounce ideas good days bad days and worries off of each other this helps tremendously if he knows have big project coming up he ll pick up pizza on the way home or take the kids to the park most articles say leave work at work we felt like that was more work than talking about it open up the lines of communication know my husband does want to hear about me taking tons continuing education classes do want to hear about reprogramming the server but it something he excited about and needs extra cool down time just like need quiet and cool down time after all the tests tldr you guys are team in every way be each other cheerleader partner and best friend sounds like you re on the right track good luck awesome thank you it took many years for me to be able to relax when know that there are dishes in the sink or laundry to fold list person so made list every time crossed something off would reward myself with break there alllllllways going to be laundry and dishes and garbage and shoes everywhere but there not always going to be sweet baby to rock and snuggle +1 for cleaning lady work demanding job am in grad school and have two littles the state of disarray in the house was adding to my anxiety we started with cleaners 1x week and now they come every other week scheduled them for fridays so when the weekend started my to do list was sooo much shorter was great for my marriage too as my husband did have to carry so much around the house either also have started time blocking certain times for certain tasks that way do get so overwhelmed by all that needs done know there time set for that thursday so do have to worry about it now also sleep healthy eating and support from other moms removed removed even if you think you re helping around the house lot even more than most husbands please read this article and look at yourself objectively https www theguardian com world those things are this this is so true you did ask me to arg my therapist told me should stop and just give my spouse chance to be competent things have been better but just sent him reminder email to schedule the baby dr appointment specifically on day he can take her ve had to take my days for her cranky post immunization afternoons enough he can take turn this https www pathospilates com single post pilates on prenatal fatigue might help again this is me am very proactive and help lead our house hold do sit back and only do what is asked of me it kind of frustrating that hours after post multiple comments about my role not being an issue more people continue to give the same thoughts and those comments get multiple upvotes hope it just people not really taking the time to read my other comments and just commenting off the first thing they see because am feeling borderline insulted usually small things like misremembering or even writing the wrong dates and times for certain things not getting normal work load done at work forgetting milk at work or pump parts at home wine lots of wine but seriously it will get easier under was the toughest for me with my second son honestly take bit of time to recharge myself an hour or so to nap read book get my nails done hair cut coffee massage just let her know the best advice got was that can do it all she sounds like the kind of mom woman who doesn stop til it all done dishes will be there laundry will be there papers to grade will be there people who judge you by the mess you house is don understand the true value in where and how you spend your time it ok for her to let something go so she can get to bed earlier and allow her to be little selfish here and there ve come to realize over the years one of my biggest stress relievers it doesn have to do with changing my schedule or lightening my work load it has to do with positive reinforcement my mother is one of the most positive individuals ve ever met she see the good in everything being able to vent to someone that listens and then have them recognize and express something positive about the situation makes it all so much more bearable for some reason for instance you could remind her how this is all temporary the kids will get older and go to school and she will have much more free time or reminding her how all of the work she is doing is going to be essentially worth it this is just what helps me little tip that can stretch long ways keep up the team work you guys sound like power couple that perfectly normal for me and stay home mum it 10000 understandable for her to forget things sometimes assuming you help her out if she tells you she forgotten something do my best the days that she has her second job get the kids home cook bathe and get the kids down about the time am saying good night she walks in she usually eats and if already have the baby down she pumps while start picking up the to explosion at this point it already and we both finish up that last few things the days that she does have her second job differ those days the work load at home is easier but she usually vents more about stress at work sometimes we can spend an hour day talking about her stress rather than actually taking time to relax she works so hard that she ca turn it off think that if she thinks worries about her problems when she has free time that she feels like she is being proactive or some how planning brainstorming it hard for me to help her relax have to find the balance if try and be too blunt about her not needing to worry then it would come across as if thought her concerns were dumb if go too far into the rabbit hole with her then we waste lot of time re hashing the same things that causes her to end even more frustrated and tired do this all of the time some days it helps but sometimes she does want to hear it sometimes if am trying to be too optimistic or positive she feels like she not being heard it hard to know what she needs sometimes she wants little tough love and what to know that she is over reacting sometimes she just wants me to listen and acknowledge her concerns sometimes she wants my advice and some help think that really most women though it all about knowing what is wanted in the moment and that hard usually get it right out of 10 times maybe she looking to have reddit tell you what she does want to because it ll lead to an argument does your wife drive to work drive about an hour and some weeks that my only alone time use it to relax it cliche but started listening to podcasts to help transition my focus find that on days when do transition my focus scattered at work because still in mommy mode and if worries about work not very with it mom those days also created what ~i~ pinterest calls battlestation it is white board with calendar for two weeks out more detailed weekly calendar schedule with appointments times meal plans etc and an even more detailed daily schedule for my daughter food sleep play also have list of chores update every three days frequency varies if my husband has 15 minutes he does task on the task board he can check the schedule if he is confused about something or wants to schedule something all without having to check in with me you say your wife had jobs but she actually has think on most but not all families the burden of household management falls on the moms so having the board helps to empower my husband to make decisions and contribute without me micromanaging the organization helps with mommy brain lot and doing something like listening to podcasts or books while driving to re focus helps be present with what you need to be doing meditating helps too but it not for everyone wow there lots going on here no wonder she tired it does get better yes but in order for that to happen she needs to let go of the mom guilt we all carry encourage her to take time to do things for herself she ca be at her best if she always putting herself last something many of us moms do pretty consistently this is it if she ca let stuff go around the house it may be because she knows it ll just pile up for her later clean more than my spouse but he always cleans on tuesdays due to his schedule so when have bigger workload do have to stress about letting the cleaning go bit cuz it ll be done on tuesday at least do you have shared family calendar that you regularly check and help add appointments or reminders if not that bad sign as far as being an equal partnership again not referring to workload but responsibility gt it does help us financially and she is great with the boys but we have to pat her ego and deal with her throwing major and unwarranted fits on weekly basis fits need to stop either the kids go to daycare or you sit down with the mom and tell her that you need her help to help your wife second house cleaner 4x per month seriously no more cleaning of bathrooms or kitchen floor mopping not just the process of *doing* it but also the process of *keeping track* of it swear it will help you find the house cleaner schedule the cleaning take charge how do you divide household labor now could you make the divisions more explicit so that for instance you handle all laundry so that she never has to think about it it sounds from your description like you do your share of the work but she may still be keeping the work that you do in her own mental space there huge level of freedom in letting go of that being aware that the oil needs changing in the car and that someone else did it is different from just being able to drive the car and never think about the oil what happens at night with the month old is she up lot at night to do feedings could you switch to co sleeping or do some formula feeding or something so that she gets more sleep what happens with food meal planning shopping cooking clean up is there way to make this simpler is she eating nutritious tasty meals sometimes it helps to divide this up by weeks so one person is in charge of meal planning for one week and another person the next or maybe you could do some bulk meal prep on the weekend together or ve heard good things about the instapot combination slow cooker pressure cooker would it be worth investing in something like that could you guys switch to disposable plates etc for little while just to cut down on stuff to do does she ever get time at home by herself or are there always kids there could you or your mil take the kids out for an afternoon and let her just be alone to do whatever she wants whether that watch netflix episode take nap or even catch up on cleaning if that what she needs to do to feel satisfied my greatest moments of stress are when just need *space* around me and it does help for my husband to encourage me to go out because want that space to be silent and in my own apartment even just an hour of being alone with no one else there and nothing to do can help me reset sorry for all the hate do know what it is about parenting subs but there seems to be lot of hate towards husbands not all husbands sit on their butt many are equal contributors in the house which it sounds like you and not over spending doctors appointments meal planning and other things what things do you rehash and get mad about that might help to find ideas to help she has too much on her plate she needs to same anxieties about doing good enough job at her new job or not making enough milk or just drama with her mom always tell her that she can stop breastfeeding but she really enjoys it she just hates pumping this is our last baby so she wants to enjoy it before kids we argued about silly things but after kids we vent out our days but rarely argue guess my biggest argument is not getting enough attention physically or emotionally and rarely bring it up she can go weeks without asking me how my work is going even though we talk about hers everyday and can go months without physical affection sure ll get torn up and the comments about even mentioning this but never guilt her ve never once made her feel like she was obligated to do anything ever for me and ve done such good job at making her feel that it okay she does ever feel obligated and when she is stressed am the last thing on her mind glad that she does have to worry about me but overtime it hurts this hate having to manage my husband time but he desperately needs it we have spent years working out systems for ourselves to help lower my stress level associated with this sounds like supermom is going hard having more stress relax would doing some stretches together while you re chatting be more effective having longer commute can be an opportunity to relax and listen to some podcasts do some meditative breathing or mindfulness exercises had trouble not taking work home too and to deal with my anxiety write down my concerns in check list and stick them in my planner to worry about later like scheduling time for my worry then could focus on relaxing sometimes only able to turn it off doing guided meditation like quiet mind cafe on youtube good on you for cooking and helping with the kids having strong supportive partner makes all the difference hope you re doing meal prep day to streamline things it lot less stressful when you do have to worry about feeding everyone came here to say exactly this reading through your comments her stress is the second job and it is household division of chores it childcare with an emotionally unstable provider mil is obviously overwhelmed as well full time is no go but just couple day break might make all the difference for your wife and her mom is there anyone you can trust or pay to provide care just days week other family friend someone from church free local program like headstart if it were me quit the second job single mother to kids and work full time and in grad school so it is *possible* to make it all work but my life is exhausting and spread really ca see how it worth the extra stress and time commitment also maybe she should talk to her doctor about different med wellbutrin is safe for breastfeeding and does cause fatigue it somewhat stimulating and gives more energy the oldest goes to daycare days week on days that my mil is not feeling well it whatever either take off or have other family cover is there somewhere else the youngest can go on those days as well from another mom feeling stressed thanks for the advice in addition to your food related suggestions just wanted to add consider getting meal service we love ours because it means that we do have to plan meals cut down on grocery store trips spend less mental energy while cooking because we do have to work out the timing are eating healthier and more adventurous food baby 10 months eats whatever we re eating and it is surprising what he likes don have any amazing suggestions just want to commend you for being great partner thank you for looking out for your wife you sir are wonderful man the biggest of high fives to you regarding mom brain finally getting back my mental capacity about 10 months post partum it is directly related to the amount of uninterrupted sleep get at night my little one still does typically sleep through the night but starting about month ago he has the occasional hour straight sleep never know when that hour stretch is going to happen so the key is to go to bed early 9:00 is the earliest can manage on the days when do have to catch up on work in the evening another trick that we re super happy about is our google home philips hue combo it has stopped the spread of so many colds illnesses through our home it is worth it for just that reason we have one of the color changing bulbs in the nursery and set it to dim red during night time feedings and diaper changes this means that baby stays in sleep mode longer is easier to put down at night bonus the home mini can be used as an ambient noise machine with about 10 different sounds and nice fade out when finished nap duration increased once we figured that out man get where she is coming from while only have kid yrs have full time day job own dance school and sit on few boards as well and honestly sometimes the exhaustion lo still not sleeping my fitbit says average hours night is almost too much try to find ways of fitting in exercise take the stairs every morning 12 floors as that boosts my energy levels do drills with my kids at dance and find ways to turn playing with my little one into exercise for both of us also try to do some meditation pranayama every night before bed read lay in bed and do brief meditation or some breath work yes often fall asleep while doing this ve found if can do prep work on the weekends get some slowcooker premade meals ready it really helps the rushed feeling during the week and makes me feel more in control that being said would be able to do it without my dh we tag team getting ready in the morning get dressed while he is still sleeping get lo dressed while he makes breakfast amp coffee then feed lo while he gets dressed also while try to eat healthy and balanced ve found that taking vitamins and some supplements is helpful when first went back to work after mat leave in the spring while was functioning it was close call to exhaustion she helped me with some supplements for energy and balancing my nutrient intake best of luck to you both just wanted to post to let you know that just the fact that you re reaching out on here shows that your good husband and father this may be counter intuitive but as working mom that just ended seasonal job summer end of fall all can say is for her to barrel through and try not to worry about the small stuff now that my second gig is over actually feel little bored to be honest it hard to unwind at night not having to think of so much like planning for the next day making sure all my ducks are in row she sounds like strong women she ll get through it if in fact it is just seasonal and will come to and end soon if this schedule was constant with no end in sight yeah say lose something either send the kids to daycare which may suggest anyway so they can get socialization or quit the second job this is more about you than you know you feel that you are the last person she has time for get her breastfeeding issues while that lead to not wanting to be touched her body is still all out of whack feel like could not be affectionate without having to turn down my husband one thing that really helped us is hugs it must be at least 10 seconds it would be just making dinner in the kitchen and taking minute to hug also give it time the first year is very hard maybe talk to family that you to see if they would take the kids during the day and go christmas shopping together it doesn have to be night date and you can just relax maybe tell her no work talk good luck it not me she has never been an affectionate person her parents used to joke about how the only time she would give them hugs as when she was crying it just how she wired this is anything new honestly it more that she feel so comfortable knowing that do expect it from her that it really is just the last thing on her mind it hard to hear but take some time away and come back and read through all of the work that has been done for you in this thread there lot of good stuff you keep refusing anything that is asking for your own self reflection there are lot of factors at play here and one of them is you with all of the words you ve used to describe your experience you ve never responded to one of the mothers here with thanks whether or not you liked what they had to say this is what we re talking about when we talk about emotional labor all of the work that been done here that you are acting entitled to yes there are lot of good things here my wife and have been looking at them in great deal we re now considering adjusting our daycare situation and she thinking about dropping the second job at first when she started to read some of the comments about me needing to reflect and help more she felt positive that they were women out there looking out for her then she started reading more and more and her positivity turn into anger we re taking notes on the good posts but probably going to delete the post later because she getting upset on the direction this is going it be hard to post but summary of how working now block hours at work weekly for my weekly review going through all my email phone messages notes projects and open items keep to do list and each day block time for the most important things to get done also block time for email and am trying to keep to those times found was in my email way too much and it was stressing me out set time couple days week for home tasks too reading school newsletters rsvp to birthday parties thank you notes school forms whatever that way not doing it all week also set time for phone calls with family and friends that otherwise fall to the bottom of the list it helped me learn to say no because if something does fit in the calendar clearly ca do it gt my greatest moments of stress are when just need space around me and it does help for my husband to encourage me to go out because want that space to be silent and in my own apartment this is exactly how am my husband tries to take our son out for half day at least once week usually saturday mornings and it helps my stress levels immensely let be real those mornings are my *sanity
